revised_title: Fossil Elk of Ireland: Geological and Paleontological Analysis
tldr: The author examines the fossilized remains of the Irish elk found in the peat and marl layers in Ireland, concluding that these remains are of relatively recent origin. The author also discusses the surrounding geological and environmental context, including the presence of freshwater shells in the marl layers, which supports the idea that the elk lived in these regions not long ago.
